intro: Hieracium rapifolium, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium rapifolium is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
